--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2022/0735 b) Date of Occurrence: 29/01/2024
c) Installation Details: Banshee Fast - AC-6525-154 at
Maintenance Hub-Y
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Electrical b) Date Component 08/02/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Lighting System d) Main Assembly: Rack-Alpha
e) Nomenclature: Lighting System Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: MOD-D
g) Part No.: EL-3030-G6 h) Sl No.: SN-2429-228
i) Firmware Version: FW-1.1.797 j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 13/10/2020 l) Date of Removal: 05/02/2024
Pg No: 122 Ln No: 16 Pg No: 67 Ln No: 25
m) Manufacturing Agency: Quantum Flight Systems n) Date, Month & Year May 2016
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: Yes p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 4531 Hrs / 211 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Minor
b) Defect Observed: Intermittent power loss during flight operations. Anomaly detected during routine
inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Foreign object damage to critical surface
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Lighting System component. Inspection
revealed damage to critical components.
c) Remedial Measures Repair damaged area using approved repair scheme
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Reduce inspection interval for affected component type
d) Attributable Code: NFF - No Failure Found
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Detailed analysis indicates design margins are adequate. Failure attributed to operational factors. Concur with findings.
Date: 06/03/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Air Cmde R.K. Joshi

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 09/03/2024 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User perspective considered. Recommend update to operating procedures based on lessons learned.
Date: 11/03/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality assurance framework assessed. Investigation process followed established protocols. Findings are valid.
Date: 12/03/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr V.K. Patel
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design authority review completed. Recommend continued airworthiness monitoring of affected component type.
Date: 11/03/2024 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
